metadata.title: NBA CBA Study Materials - Batch 11: Article XIV - Trading of Player Contracts
metadata.importance: CRITICAL - Agents must understand trade mechanics for negotiations

studyNote: Article XIV governs all player trades. Agents must understand trade deadlines, salary matching rules, trade restrictions, player consent requirements, and how trades affect contracts and benefits.

questions.question: What is the NBA trade deadline each season?
questions.explanation: The trade deadline is the third Thursday in February at 3:00pm ET. After this, no trades can be completed until after the Finals.

questions.question: Can players be traded after the trade deadline?
options: No, trading closes until next season
Yes, but only for draft picks
questions.explanation: No player trades can occur after the trade deadline. Trading reopens the day after the NBA Finals conclude.

questions.question: Can a player with a no-trade clause be traded without consent?
options: Yes, all players can be traded
No, player must consent or waive the clause
questions.explanation: Players with no-trade clauses cannot be traded without their explicit consent to waive the clause.

questions.question: Can a recently signed free agent be traded immediately?
options: No, must wait 3 months or until December 15, whichever is later
No, must wait one full season
Yes, but only for other free agents
questions.explanation: Players who sign as free agents cannot be traded for 3 months or until December 15 (whichever is later) to prevent sign-and-trade circumvention.

questions.question: Can multiple players be packaged together in a trade?
questions.explanation: Teams can trade any number of players in a single transaction, as long as salary matching rules are satisfied.

questions.question: Can draft picks be traded?
options: Yes, but cannot trade consecutive first-round picks
Yes, but only within the same conference
questions.explanation: Teams can trade draft picks but cannot trade away first-round picks in consecutive years (the 'Stepien Rule').

questions.question: What is the 'Stepien Rule'?
options: Teams must keep their lottery pick
Teams cannot trade first-round picks in consecutive years
Teams cannot trade more than 3 picks per year
Teams must have at least one first-rounder every 3 years
questions.explanation: Named after Ted Stepien, this rule prevents teams from trading first-round picks in consecutive years to protect franchises from poor decisions.

questions.question: Can a player be traded multiple times in the same season?
options: No, must wait one year between trades
questions.explanation: Players can be traded multiple times in the same season, though there are restrictions on re-acquiring players you traded away.

questions.question: Can a team re-acquire a player they traded away in the same season?
options: No, must wait until the following July 1
questions.explanation: Teams cannot re-acquire a player they traded away until the one-year anniversary of the trade or July 1 of the following year, whichever comes first.

questions.question: Must traded players report to their new team?
options: No, can refuse and become free agent
questions.explanation: Player contracts are fully transferable. Traded players must report to their new team unless they have a no-trade clause.

questions.question: Can cash be included in trades?
options: Yes, up to $5 million per season
questions.explanation: Teams can include up to $5 million in cash considerations per league year in trades.

questions.question: What happens to a player's Bird Rights when traded?
options: Bird Rights transfer to the new team
Bird Rights frozen for one year
questions.explanation: Bird Rights transfer with the player to the acquiring team, maintaining the years of service credit.

questions.question: Can a player on a Two-Way Contract be traded?
options: No, Two-Way players cannot be traded
Yes, same rules as standard contracts
questions.explanation: Two-Way Contract players can be traded following the same rules as players on standard NBA contracts.

questions.question: What is a 'trade exception'?
options: Permission to exceed salary cap in trades
questions.explanation: A trade exception allows teams to acquire players in trades that would otherwise violate salary cap rules, created when trading away more salary than received.

questions.question: How long does a trade exception last?
questions.explanation: Trade exceptions expire one year from the date they were created, though they can be used at any point during that year.

questions.question: Can teams trade players who are injured?
options: Yes, with full disclosure to acquiring team
questions.explanation: Injured players can be traded, but the acquiring team must be fully informed of the injury status and have access to medical records.

questions.question: What happens if a trade is found to have violated CBA rules?
options: Trade can be voided by Commissioner
questions.explanation: The Commissioner can void trades that violate CBA rules, potentially imposing additional penalties on the teams involved.

questions.question: Can a player be traded while on suspension?
options: Yes, suspension transfers to new team
questions.explanation: Suspended players can be traded, and the suspension continues with the acquiring team.

questions.question: Must teams notify players before trading them?
options: Only for players with 5+ years service
questions.explanation: Teams are not required to notify players before trades, though many do as a courtesy. Players typically learn when the trade becomes public.

questions.question: Can draft pick rights be traded?
options: Yes, pick swap rights and protections can be traded
questions.explanation: Teams can trade draft picks with various protections (lottery protected, top-10 protected, etc.) and pick swap rights.

questions.question: What is a 'sign-and-trade'?
options: Signing a free agent then immediately trading them
Trading for a player then extending them
questions.explanation: Sign-and-trade occurs when a team signs their own free agent to a new contract and simultaneously trades them to another team.

questions.question: Are there restrictions on sign-and-trades?
options: Yes, acquiring team must have cap space or exception, and player must consent
questions.explanation: Sign-and-trades require player consent, and the acquiring team must have sufficient cap space or a trade exception to absorb the salary.

questions.question: Can international player rights be traded?
options: Yes, teams can trade draft rights to international players
Only if player hasn't signed overseas
questions.explanation: Teams can trade the NBA rights to drafted international players, even if those players are currently playing overseas.

questions.question: What is the 'trade call' with the league office?
options: Required call to confirm trade details and approval
questions.explanation: All trades must be reported to the league office via an official trade call where details are confirmed and league approval is obtained.

questions.question: Can teams condition trades on physicals?
options: Yes, trades can be contingent on player passing physical
questions.explanation: Trades are typically subject to players passing physicals. If a player fails, the trade can be voided.

questions.question: When do traded players officially become property of the new team?
options: When trade call is completed and approved
When player reports to new team
questions.explanation: Players become property of the acquiring team once the trade call is completed and the league approves the transaction.

questions.question: Can teams trade future second-round picks without restriction?
options: Yes, can trade up to 7 years ahead
questions.explanation: Teams can trade second-round picks up to 7 years in advance, unlike first-round picks which have more restrictions.

questions.question: What happens to a player's contract guarantees after a trade?
questions.explanation: All contract terms, including guarantees, remain fully in effect when a player is traded. The acquiring team assumes all obligations.

questions.question: Can a team trade a player they just claimed off waivers?
questions.explanation: Players claimed off waivers can be traded immediately, though there may be salary matching considerations.

questions.question: What is a '3-team trade'?
questions.explanation: Multi-team trades involve 3 or more teams exchanging players, picks, and/or cash simultaneously to make salary matching work.
